result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael James Bartlein

defendant.name: Bartlein, Michael James
defendant.address: 420 Cedar St Apt C25  PO Box C25, Baldwin, WI 54002

records.addlTxt: Restitution worksheet- informational. Filed by DA Office. arc

1:48 PM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Unmonitored DAR, Clk: K. Anderson, Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Abrianna Dolfi and Intern Lanie Krause in court for DE, Defendant Michael James Bartlein in court. DE does not qualify for public defender, PFAC provided. DE confirms address. Waives reading.  NG. DE states that he was offered to pay restitution in the amount of $7 and he did so prior to today's hearing. ADA Ellenwood moves to amend Ct 1 to County Ordinance 61 - Trepass to Land. NC/GNC. Court accepts plea. Court orders $114.50 - 60 DTP. Adjourned: 1:52 PM. kma
Clerk mailed PFAC and copy of Complaint to DE on today's date, to address on file. bph
Filed by DA Office Erin M. arc
to appear via zoom for 10/14 hearing. olg   Per EFV 10/14/2022: Approved with camera capability.

1:56 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Michael Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Stephanie Schmidt in court. Defendant Michael James Bartlein appeared by video. Court addresses DE. DE states has not seen criminal complaint. Clerk to mail DE copy of criminal complaint. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant doesn't qualify for PD- PFAC mailed to DE. ADA Becker makes offer to DE. Court sets INIT. Adjourned 02:01 PM
Initial appearance scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Initial appearance on October 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
